snippet: As executive director of a federal agency, Jeffrey Farrow makes over $100,000 a year. At the same time, he has lobbied for clients overseas.
abstract: Jeffrey Farrow served as head of federal agency Commission for the Preservation of America’s Heritage Abroad, earning more than $100,000 annually, while also receiving fees of up to $750,000 a year lobbying for foreign agents; his work for private clients has overlapped directly with his public duties; experts contend different roles he has played are, if not illegal, extremely unusual.
lead_paragraph: As executive director of a federal agency, Jeffrey Farrow makes over $100,000 a year. At the same time, he has lobbied for clients overseas.

headline.main: The Lobbyist With a Six-Figure Government Job
headline.print_headline: The Lobbyist With a Six-Figure Government Job

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United States Commission for the Preservation of America's Heritage Abroad
